channel.title: CVE Feed for ameliabooking -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ameliabooking -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-6225|2024-06-28T19:01:03.560Z -- ameliabooking -- booking%20for%20appointments%20and%20events%20calendar%20%E2%80%93%20amelia
item.description: The Booking for Appointments and Events Calendar – Amelia plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via admin settings in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5 (and 7.5.1 for the Pro version) due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with administrator-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. This only affects multi-site installations and installations where unfiltered_html has been disabled.

item.title: CVE-2023-6808|2024-02-05T21:21:57.486Z -- ameliabooking -- booking%20for%20appointments%20and%20events%20calendar%20%E2%80%93%20amelia
item.description: The Booking for Appointments and Events Calendar – Amelia plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.93 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1484|2024-06-04T17:59:29.786Z -- ameliabooking -- booking%20for%20appointments%20and%20events%20calendar%20%E2%80%93%20amelia
item.description: The Booking for Appointments and Events Calendar – Amelia plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the date parameters in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.98 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-6225|2024-06-21T07:39:57.465Z -- ameliabooking -- booking%20for%20appointments%20and%20events%20calendar%20%E2%80%93%20amelia
item.description: The Booking for Appointments and Events Calendar – Amelia plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via admin settings in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.5 (and 7.5.1 for the Pro version) due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with administrator-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. This only affects multi-site installations and installations where unfiltered_html has been disabled.
